DataElement.preferredName: Iron Chelation Therapeutic Procedure Fulfill Criterion Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information relating to whether the iron chelation therapeutic procedure criterion was met.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Iron Chelation Therapeutic Procedure Fulfill Criterion
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Iron Chelation involves non-covalent coordination bonding between iron and an organic chemical, often as part of an enzyme or protein complex, as in the iron-binding porphyrin group of hemoglobin._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did iron chelation therapy meet the following criteria: initiated within 18 months of the first transfusion and administered for at least 5 days / week (either oral or parenteral iron chelation medication)?
